text.0: the men have lifted indra up the vṛtra slayer to joy and strength.
text.1: him verily we invocate in battles whether great or small be he our aid in deeds of might.
text.2: thou hero art a warrior thou art giver of abundant spoil.
text.3: strengthening een the feeble thou aidest the sacrificer thou givest the offerer ample wealth.
text.4: when war and battles are on foot booty is laid before the bold.
text.5: yoke thou thy wildlyrushing bays whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich do thou o indra make us rich.
text.6: mighty through wisdom as he lists terrible he hath waxed in strength.
text.7: lord of bay steeds strongjawed sublime he in joined hands for glorys sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt.
text.8: he filled the earthly atmosphere and pressed against the lights in heaven.
text.9: none like thee ever hath been born none indra will be born like thee thou hast waxed mighty over all.
text.10: may he who to the offerer gives the foemans mansustaining food.
text.11: may indra lend his aid to us deal forthabundant is thy wealththat in thy bounty i may share.
text.12: he righteoushearted at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine.
text.13: gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts sharpen thou us and bring us wealth.
text.14: refresh thee hero with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength.
text.15: we know thee lord of ample store to thee have sent our hearts desires be therefore our protector thou.
text.16: these people indra keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice.
text.17: discover thou as lord the wealth of men who offer up no gifts bring thou to us this wealth of theirs.
